intro: Tetracarpum wislizeni, commonly known as the wislizeni tetracarpum, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds, aiding in its dispersal. Tetracarpum wislizeni is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments.
